description: Learned borrowing from Ancient Greek προσωποποιία (prosōpopoiía, “dramatization, the putting of speeches into the mouths of characters”); surface analysis, prosopo- +‎ -poeia.

nouns.description: prosopopoeia (countable and uncountable, plural prosopopoeias or prosopopoeiae)

entries.meaning: (rhetoric) An act of personifying a person or object when communicating to an audience; a figure of speech involving this.
